title: Reforested Areas Rival Mature Forests in Securing Water

title: Amazon Deforestation Leads to Drier Dry Seasons

title: Panama Indigenous-Led Reforestation Restores Hydrological Cycles

title: Tropical Deforestation Disrupts Global Rainfall Patterns

description: Lummi Nation leads Salish Sea restoration for salmon and orca recovery in Puget Sound.

title: USA Blackfeet Nation Badger-Two Medicine
description: Blackfeet Nation protects Badger-Two Medicine area from development, preserving headwaters.

description: Standing Rock Sioux Tribe defends Missouri River watershed from pipeline threatening water supply.

title: USA White Mountain Apache Forest
description: White Mountain Apache Tribe manages 1.6 million acre reservation for watershed and wildlife.

title: USA Tohono O'odham Desert Restoration
description: Tohono O'odham Nation implements desert restoration using traditional water harvesting techniques.

description: Seminole Tribe partners in Everglades restoration protecting Florida's water supply.

description: Miccosukee Tribe advocates for Everglades water quality and flow restoration.

title: USA Cherokee Nation Watershed
description: Cherokee Nation manages water resources across 14-county jurisdiction in Oklahoma.

description: Osage Nation restores tallgrass prairie on reservation, sequestering carbon and improving watershed.

title: USA Red Lake Nation Forest
description: Red Lake Band manages 800,000 acres of boreal forest in Minnesota for watershed and wildlife.

title: USA Leech Lake Tribe Wild Rice
description: Leech Lake Band protects wild rice waters essential for Ojibwe culture and wetland health.

title: Global Indigenous Land Rights Study
description: Study confirms Indigenous territories with secure land rights have 80% lower deforestation rates globally.
